instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
Minor corrosion around <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> and cleaned by some flux and hot air. 

The board will chime but no display whatsoever via LCD nor thunderbolt port. 

where to look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message: Do you get 5V at pins 28-30 of J8300, at least in the first few seconds (when chimes)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message: sorry do i need to have LCD plugged in to test the 5V at pin 28-30 of J8300?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
It should appear even without LCD; but will disappear in 2-3s.
PCH needs to detect LCD, in order to maintain video voltages.

Are you not interested to check video related voltages with LCD connected?
What do you expect to get in such case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message: I do, just that I dont have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD handy right now and need to get one.. I will have the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD in a few days.. but I was trying to see if I can do some troubleshooting before that arrive. e.g. getting it to display via thunderbolt or something like that..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
"Do you get 5V at pins 28-30 of J8300, at least in the first few seconds (when chimes)?"
As above mentioned, you can test that without LCD; a minimal test.

You've mentioned corrosion on <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>.
Resolder all its pins and check related components and traces.
Do you get any output from it?
<SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
Yes, I do have 5V for a few seconds at pins 28-30 of J8300 after resoldering all pins of <CHIP>U3210</CHIP>. Actually my LCD arrived and I have hooked it up and saw the flashing folder so it actually displayed via LCD now.

However, BOTH thunderbolt port are still not working, <SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> is 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
Isn't more convenient to use HDMI  instead of thunderbolt adapter?

I suspect something damaged by corrosion on thunderbolt area.
Check <SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL> on the port where you insert thunderbolt device.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message: how do I check those pin without causing a short into the metal shield?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
sorry, turns out this has more problem. keyboard not working (power on button seems to work) but other key has no response after boot up. Trackpad also not working and the known good IO board also not working. 

something more serious upstream?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A chime but no display on both LCD and thunderbolt port
threads.message:
So trackpad/keyboard work in boot menu. but no in macOS?
Check <RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> and L4807 and all resistors around <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>.
<SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> stays at 0V?
